name: Authentic Lebanese Fattoush
author: George
summary: Fattoush is a Lebanese salad, good for hot weather. This recipe uses two unusual ingredients: sumac and purslane. Sumac, usually sold ground, is ground red berries and used in Middle Eastern, particularly Lebanese, cooking. Purslane is succulent with a lemony flavor, and makes a nice salad green. I find them at farmer's markets.
ingredients: 1 head romaine lettuce, torn into bite-size pieces
¼ cup chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley
1  green bell pepper, seeded and chopped
4  pita rounds, toasted and torn into pieces
directions: Mix the water and cornstarch in a small saucepan over medium-high heat until thickened
Remove from heat, and mix in lemon juice, garlic, sumac, salt, and pepper
In a large bowl, toss together the lettuce, cucumber, tomatoes, green onions, parsley, mint, bell pepper, purslane, and arugula
Toss with the dressing, and serve with pita
